content: them with yarn overs if you want them to remain tight knit your yarn overs through the back loop on next round round 1 knit round 2 kfb k1 kfb k1 kfb repeat 16 sts redistribute the stitches on to 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle 2 & 3 now have 6 sts each round 3 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 24 sts round 4 k2 kfb repeat until end of round 32 sts round 5 k3 kfb repeat until end of round 40 sts stitch count check in needle 1 should have 10 sts needle 2 & 3 should have 15 sts each round 6-9 knit round 10 purl round 11 knit cut yarn change to front main door color round 12-13 knit round 14 ssk k3 repeat until end of round 32 sts round 15 ktbl k3 repeat until end of round round 16 ssk k2 repeat until end of round 24 sts round 17 ktbl k2 repeat until end of round round 18 ssk k1 repeat until end of round 16 sts round 19 ssk repeat until end of round 8 sts draw thread through remaining 8 sts pull tight and secure make sure the center hole is completely closed so that the doorknob will have something to sit on later do not weave in end finishing can be found on page 4 hobbit hole window instructions cast on 10 sts in your wooden frame/back color leaving a long tail for stitching up hole and window cross in finishing divide the stitches over 2 dpns and join to work in the round please note if you find knit front and back increases hard on your hands feel free to substitute them with yarn overs if you want them to remain tight knit your yarn overs through the back loop on next round round 1 knit round 2 kfb k1 kfb k1 kfb repeat 16 sts redistribute the stitches on to 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle 2 & 3 now have 6 sts each round 3 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 24 sts round 4-5 knit stitch count check in needle 1 should have 10 sts needle 2 & 3 should have 15 sts each round 6 purl round 7 knit cut yarn change to front main window color round 8-9 knit round 10 ssk k1 repeat until end of round 16 sts round 11 ktbl k1 repeat until end of round round 12 ssk repeat until end of round 8 sts draw thread through remaining 8 sts pull tight and secure do not weave in end finishing can be found on page 4 3 finishing the doors and windows follow the same finishing step 1 first insert your cast off end into the center of your door or window and out through the bottom hole see figure a your cast off end should now be hanging out the bottom hole
